title: Meon Valley Trail Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Pierre Terre / Meon Valley Trail
images.caption: The dismantled railway bridge over Stocks Lane, Meonstoke. The trail heads between the gate and hedge, up the side of the embankment to join the former railway.

description: This peaceful cycling and walking trail runs along a disused railway track from West Meon to Wickham via Droxford. There are splendid views of the beautiful Meon Valley and the River Meon to enjoy as well as a variety of wildlife including butterflies, redwing and egrets. The route is reasonably flat, running along a surfaced path for just under 10 miles. Near Wickham the route skirts the edge of the Forest of Bere. You can pick up the trails in the West Walk area of the forest to extend your exercise. Our Meonstoke Walk and West Meon Walk use part of the trail to take you on a tour of the area surrounding the villages. There's some splendid views of the South Downs countryside which surrounds the trail.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Square Cow in Wickham is a good choice for refreshments after your exercise. It has some history having originally been “The Old Curio Shop”, an open hall timber framed building dating back to the sixteenth Century. Inside there are medieval paintings with floral/geometric patterns preserved behind glass and still on display. They do lovely home cooked food which you can enjoy in the pretty garden area if the weather is fine. You can find the pub on Wickham Square with a postcode of PO17 5JN for your sat navs. In Meonstoke there's the Bucks Head to investigate. The quaint inn is located in a fine spot close to the river and boasts a lovely garden area. You can find them on Shoe Lane, Exton with a postcode of SO32 3NT.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The trail is good for dog walking though you may want to keep them on leads because of the cyclists. The Square Cow pub mentioned above is also dog friendly.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The Wickham Railway Walk uses a section of the trail and the waymarked King's Way to create a circular walk around the village. The walk first follows the old railway line along the River Meon before heading to the countryside and woodland of the Forest of Bere. It's a nice varied walk and a good way to explore the surrounding area. For more walking ideas in the area see the South Downs Walks page.

display_address: Lynch Lane, West Meon, Winchester, Hampshire, England, GU32 1JH, United Kingdom
